Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Housing and Buildings the Committee on Environmental Protection the Committee on Parks and Recreation and the Committee on Transportation

Items.Title: Oversight - Rebuilding After Sandy and Improving the Resiliency of the City’s Infrastructure.
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - Rebuilding After Sandy and Improving the Resiliency of the City’s Infrastructure.

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Housing and Buildings the Committee on Environmental Protection the Committee on Parks and Recreation and the Committee on Transportation

A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, the New York city mechanical code and the New York city fire code, in relation to relocating and protecting building systems in flood-prone areas.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Relocating and protecting building systems in flood-prone areas.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, the New York city building code and the New York city mechanical code, in relation to cabling for certain building systems and fuel-oil storage in flood-prone areas.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Cabling for certain building systems and fuel-oil storage in flood-prone areas.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to removing barriers to the usage of temporary flood control and response devices.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Removing barriers to the usage of temporary flood control and response devices.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring backup power sources for fire and life safety communications systems.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring backup power sources for fire and life safety communications systems.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to improving hazardous materials storage pursuant to the New York city community right-to-know law.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Improving hazardous materials storage pursuant to the NYC community right-to-know law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city plumbing code and the New York city building code, in relation to preventing the backflow of sewage.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Preventing the backflow of sewage.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a manual on flood construction and protection standards.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Creating a manual on flood construction and protection standards.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code and the New York city mechanical code, in relation to preventing wind damage to certain buildings and systems.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Preventing wind damage to certain buildings and systems.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to studying the effects of wind on certain buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Studying the effects of wind on certain buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to using cool roof surfaces to reduce summer heat.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Using cool roof surfaces to reduce summer heat.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, the New York city building code, and the New York city mechanical code, in relation to emergency and standby power systems and natural gas usage.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Emergency and standby power systems and natural gas usage.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to secondary electrical power, heating and cooling systems for I-1 and I-2 occupancies and for adult homes, enriched housing, community residences and intermediate care facilities, where such occupancies are located in flood-prone areas.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Secondary electrical power, heating and cooling systems for I-1 and I-2 occupancies and for adult homes, enriched housing, community residences and intermediate care facilities, where such occupancies are located in flood-prone areas.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to keeping residential stairwells and hallways lit during blackouts.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Keeping residential stairwells and hallways lit during blackouts.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city plumbing code and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring residential buildings to provide drinking water to a common area supplied directly through pressure in the public water main.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring residential buildings to provide drinking water to a common area supplied directly through pressure in the public water main.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city plumbing code, in relation to requiring that toilets and faucets be capable of operating without an external supply of electrical power.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring that toilets and faucets be capable of operating without an external supply of electrical power.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to emergency preparedness recommendations for owners of residential and commercial buildings and the posting of emergency information in certain residential buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Emergency preparedness recommendations for owners of residential and commercial buildings and the posting of emergency information in certain residential buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a study on permeable roadway and sidewalk materials.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Study on permeable roadway and sidewalk materials.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to flood-resistant construction requirements for health facilities.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Flood-resistant construction requirements for health facilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to the adoption of best available flood maps.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Adoption of best available flood maps.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to enact and the President to sign the Flood Victim Premium Relief Act of 2013.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Flood Victim Premium Relief Act of 2013.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.3942/A.4380, the “Engineers’, Architects’, Landscape Architects’ and Land Surveyors’ Good Samaritan Act” which would protect from liability professional engineers, architects, landscape architects and land surveyors who render voluntary services at the scene of a natural disaster or catastrophe.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Engineers’, Architects’, Landscape Architects’ and Land Surveyors’ Good Samaritan Act (S.3942/A.4380)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to amend the Biggert-Waters Flood Insurance Reform Act of 2012.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Biggert-Waters Flood Insurance Reform Act of 2012.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to planning for resiliency to climate change as a responsibility of the office of long-term planning and sustainability.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Planning for resiliency to climate change as a responsibility of the office of long-term planning and sustainability.
